# Chord: Minor 6th in B (Shape: G)

## Brief Overview
The Minor 6th chord in the key of B with the shape of G is a unique and emotive chord that can add depth and richness to your music. It consists of four notes: B, D, F#, and G. This chord has a melancholic yet soothing quality that can evoke feelings of introspection and contemplation in a musical composition. 

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- D (Minor 3rd)
- F# (5th)
- G (6th)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The Minor 6th chord in B with the G shape is often used in jazz, blues, and soul genres. Its moody and soulful sound can add a touch of sophistication and emotional depth to a piece of music. This chord is commonly used in ballads, jazz standards, and R&B songs to create a sense of longing and introspection.

## Songs
1. **"Misty" by Erroll Garner:** This jazz standard features the Minor 6th chord in B (G shape) in various sections of the song, adding a sense of nostalgia and melancholy.
   
2. **"I'd Rather Go Blind" by Etta James:** This classic soul song uses the Minor 6th chord in B (G shape) to enhance the emotional intensity of the lyrics, creating a powerful and evocative musical backdrop.

3. **"Georgia on My Mind" by Ray Charles:** In this beloved jazz and blues standard, the Minor 6th chord in B (G shape) adds a touch of warmth and soulfulness to the iconic melody, capturing the essence of the song's poignant lyrics.
